Zhonglu Tower (Jongno Tower), located in the Zhonglu District, central Seoul. The name of Zhonglu is derived from the large Bell Tower Puxin Pavilion, which is just across the road from Zhonglu Pavilion. A 33-story office building with a restaurant at the top has excellent views of Zhonglu and other parts of Seoul. 23-30 Building is hollow.

Visiting the demilitarized zone in the Korean-Korean border area is located on the 38th Line, where one line divides the DPRK into two parts. It needs a newspaper group to visit. A locomotive damaged by the war is very conspicuous and can visit the Third Tunnel. On the memorial to the victims of the Korean War, the names of some foreigners can also be seen.

Booked a day trip to the DMZ in the unarmed zone of South Korea, RMB 245, Because it is not very convenient to go by yourself, in fact, you can also book in advance on the domestic travel website. The price will be 20 to 30 yuan cheaper than the price you see in Korea. There are also red wine train day trips, Panmunjom day trips, etc. on the domestic travel website. You can choose, of course, I am afraid that there will be changes when we come, so there is no advance reservation. Panmunjom must book a week in advance. The red wine train day trip also needs to be booked 4 days in advance. If you are interested, you must book in advance.

Holding a group for a half-day tour, the time is a bit rushed, but it is still worth seeing. Linjin Pavilion has a freedom bridge and locomotive for returning prisoners of war. The third tunnel can walk 268 meters, plus the slope of the tunnel has more than 1,000 meters back and forth, which is quite a test of physical strength. The observation deck can see the two villages and the higher flags set by the two Koreas in the DMZ. The landing platform is the symbol of South Korea's desire for reunification. After reunification, it will be the first train station to North Korea. It's good to listen to history and feel the atmosphere of war.

After the Korean War, the South and North sides took the 38-line as the boundary, and then both sides were within 2 kilometers as unarmed areas, originally intended to reduce direct conflict between the two sides. However, tourists cannot go alone, can only follow the tour group, and can not get off the bus to visit in sensitive areas, sometimes even taking pictures. The biggest gain was to see Kaesong at a closer distance, and to see North Korean soldiers passing through the window in the blue hut, satisfying my curiosity.

The demilitarized armed area on the North-South border is very worthwhile, but the time is not right. We met with the DPRK and the US. Banmenqiao could not go. We could only go to Linjin Pavilion, the third tunnel, DMZ Museum and Duro Railway Station. It was very tight to follow the regiment. If we only went to Linjin Pavilion Peace Park to suggest that kind of bus, we could wander around and take pictures on our own, but enter the demilitarized military. The district still has to follow the group, because it is very troublesome to get in by oneself. If you want to go to Panmen Bridge, you really need to take chances.

When I came to the third tunnel, it was dug by the North Koreans. Because some engineers came to South Korea from the north, they told South Korea their measurements. South Korea hit countless water pipes around this area to find the tunnel. It is said that there were several tunnels at that time. The destination is not here but Seoul, and the ambition is great.

The black paint on the tunnel rock is said to be North Korea's fake coal mine to cover up the truth of the tunnel excavation. Three concrete partitions were built along the military demarcation line. It was so thick that we could only walk to the first partition wall and then fold back to continue the small train back to the ground.
